metadata.title: CVE-2017-16545 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ReadWPGImage function in coders/wpg.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 does notproperly validate colormapped images, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (ImportIndexQuantumType invalid write andapplication crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via amalformed WPG image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5').
